text:
Children and adolescents in the age group of 1 to 19 were distributed albandezole tablets on Wednesday on the occasion of National De-worming Day.

Collector K.S.Palanisamy inaugurated the distribution at the Corporation Higher Secondary School at East Boulevard Road in the city. As against the target of 8,88,997, the tablets were given to 1,87,547 children in the age group of 1 to 5 through the Anganwadis and 7,01,450 children and among adolescents in the age group of six to 19 through the schools. Village health nurses and anganwadi workers were also pressed into service to bring out-of-school children to anganwadi centres and distribute the tablets.

Meeting

Collector K.S.Palanisamy held a meeting with representatives of political parties here on Wednesday and briefed them about the ongoing process of deleting names of deceased voters from the poll rolls. He said applications for inclusions, deletions and corrections have been received and action was being initiated over them. He urged the parties to extend their cooperation to the exercise.

Special camps

Special camps under the Assured Maximum Service to Marginalised People in All Villages (AMMA) Scheme will be held at the following places in the district on Friday: Varaganeri, Tharanallur, Pirattiyur (East), Pazhankanankudi, Kadiyakurichi, Mugavanur North, Ikkaraikosikurichi, M.Kannanur, Peragambi, Mooveli, Kombai and Periyapallipalayam. Residents of the villages can avail the services of the Revenue Department at the camp, Collector K.S.Palanisamy said in a press release.
title: De-worming Day: tablets distributed
